messages.message:
Buongiorno! 
Be kinda nice to know if you're looking to move in a direction  I might be interested in participating in.  I fully understand if it's too early to know, just know that channels and minds are both open .
messages.input:
My response to ITALY:'Buongiorno! 
Be kinda nice to know if you're looking to move in a direction  I might be interested in participating in.  I fully understand if it's too early to know, just know that channels and minds are both open .'.

messages.message:
Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen. 

I’m not writing to anyone else until I get things squared away with you. I LOVE the Wintergreen alliance. It works in the short-term (we only need to get A/T to fight) and it works in the long-term (resolves East before West, and we can’t really stab each other). Can we do this?

I don’t care if we target T first or A first. I’ll let you decide. But I want to work as your partner. I am just hoping that you’re brilliant and fun too!

I literally will not message anyone else until you and I have a plan. I want it to be clear to you that you’re the ally I want.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen. 

I’m not writing to anyone else until I get things squared away with you. I LOVE the Wintergreen alliance. It works in the short-term (we only need to get A/T to fight) and it works in the long-term (resolves East before West, and we can’t really stab each other). Can we do this?

I don’t care if we target T first or A first. I’ll let you decide. But I want to work as your partner. I am just hoping that you’re brilliant and fun too!

I literally will not message anyone else until you and I have a plan. I want it to be clear to you that you’re the ally I want.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message in this situation. The excessive repetition of "Wintergreen" and the strong emotional appeal to form an exclusive alliance without considering other diplomatic options could indicate manipulation or desperation on Italy's part. It is important to proceed with caution and not get overly influenced by the emotional tone of the message.

messages.message: Well, Italy and France are, in my opinion, some of the best possible partners for Russia, so how could I possibly turn down such enthusiastic overtures from one of them?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Well, Italy and France are, in my opinion, some of the best possible partners for Russia, so how could I possibly turn down such enthusiastic overtures from one of them?'.

messages.message: Lovely. Would you rather we target Turkey first or Austria? I’m okay either way.

messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's straightforward question about targeting Turkey or Austria first shows a willingness to collaborate and adapt to your preferences, which is a positive sign of genuine cooperation.

messages.message: To be perfectly honest, that's hard to say right now, since the decision doesn't really affect my opening moves any (the standard southern opening spring moves are equally useful against either one), and I'd likely need to adjust based on what else happens on the Spring turn.  Easiest just to say I'm opening South, flexibly considering the follow-through against either one of them.

messages.message:
Okay. Fair enough. One reason it might matter is because I could open with an aggressive attack on Austria if you want to blitz him quickly (e.g., DMZ Gal and then break it). Or you could organize a bounce in Gal and then not move there. On the other hand, if you’d prefer to take out Turkey first, I could go the standard Lepanto route. I’m happy to go either way, but I’d really like to coordinate with you if you’re game.

Maybe we both need a fuller picture of what is happening first. I’ll begin to reach out to others now.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Okay. Fair enough. One reason it might matter is because I could open with an aggressive attack on Austria if you want to blitz him quickly (e.g., DMZ Gal and then break it). Or you could organize a bounce in Gal and then not move there. On the other hand, if you’d prefer to take out Turkey first, I could go the standard Lepanto route. I’m happy to go either way, but I’d really like to coordinate with you if you’re game.

Maybe we both need a fuller picture of what is happening first. I’ll begin to reach out to others now.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message in this situation. Italy's sudden shift towards reaching out to others after expressing a strong desire to coordinate exclusively with you raises doubts about their sincerity and commitment to the proposed alliance. The mention of potentially aggressive actions against Austria despite your earlier neutral stance is a red flag that should be taken into consideration. It is advisable to proceed cautiously and evaluate your options carefully.

messages.message:
Hey, so, Austria seems to want to Lepanto now. 

You’re still the ally I want. And I’d like either to cut down Austria quickly or cut down Turkey quickly. 

If we decide to take out Austria first, I’d like you to let Austria in to Gal (just tell him this was a mistake). This will make it very hard for him to defend against me.

If we decide to take out Turkey first, bounce Austria, and I’ll open as a traditional Lepanto.

Thoughts?
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Hey, so, Austria seems to want to Lepanto now. 

You’re still the ally I want. And I’d like either to cut down Austria quickly or cut down Turkey quickly. 

If we decide to take out Austria first, I’d like you to let Austria in to Gal (just tell him this was a mistake). This will make it very hard for him to defend against me.

If we decide to take out Turkey first, bounce Austria, and I’ll open as a traditional Lepanto.

Thoughts?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message in this situation. Italy's specific instructions on misleading Austria and the ultimatum-like tone of deciding between targeting Austria or Turkey swiftly suggest a manipulative and potentially unreliable approach to diplomacy. Proceed with caution and consider the long-term implications of such a proposed alliance strategy.

messages.message: Sent to Germany, England, Austria, Russia: So, England, Germany, Russia, y’all played a great turn last turn. You got me to stab my long-time ally and you ended our pretty excellent 7-year run as an alliance. Russia told me he was with me if I stab Austria. England told me he wanted me to solo so long as I would “teach him” and help his along to second place. Then y’all pulled the rug out from under me. It was clever and effective. (End Part 1)

messages.output: You should not trust the message in this situation. Italy's message indicates a sense of betrayal and frustration towards the other players, highlighting a sudden change in alliances and a perceived undermining of trust. The detailed account of the perceived manipulation and deception within the former alliance suggests a significant shift in the diplomatic landscape of the game. It is crucial to carefully assess the implications of this message and consider the new dynamics that may arise from these revelations.

messages.message:
(Part 2)
At this stage, my excitement about the game has diminished quite a bit. And of course I’m happy to play on and take my lumps for falling for “Hey, I really want you to solo, just help me place second,” but if you guys just want to call it a five-way draw among us and grab a beer together, while reviewing the statistics, that’s really my preference. 

I am outnumbered and I obviously can’t solo. And I’m sure some of you in the north are eager to send everyone else flying my way, but I expect Russia and England to be careful, and so I’m not sure there is much room to move forward without simply tipping the board to Germany’s favor. 

I propose that we draw and hug it out.🤗

I am outnumbered and I obviously can’t solo. And I’m sure some of you in the north are eager to send everyone else flying my way, but I expect Russia and England to be careful, and so I’m not sure there is much room to move forward without simply tipping the board to Germany’s favor. 

I propose that we draw and hug it out.🤗'.
